comment.author: 24231207@N07
comment._content:
According to NYT of July 20, 1914, Capt. A.P. Lundin's lifeboat had a wildly successful test run from Bayside Yacht Club to Larchmont Yacht Club.

Mr & Mrs Elnar Sivard were planning on sailing the small vessel across the Atlantic for their wedding trip.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: A link to the New York Times story: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F4061EFB385A12... [Incidentally, the outbreak of World War I canceled plans for the Lifeboat's ocean crossing, sparing the reckless Sivards to live another day . . . .]
